message.content:
{"id": "27869", 
 "title": "Bug 27869StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData", 
 "description": "Bug 27869StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData.\nBtw, UTF8 is the default English encoding for Redhat 8.\nFontMetrics API is also extensively used by the StyledText. It is suggested that the metric information should be cached in the StyledText and only updated when the font is changed.", 
 "OB": "When running eclipse and using the Java Editor, a single key stroke can cause the API Font.getFontData() to be called 13 times. This API is also overused when scrolling the StyledText and selecting text. Each Font has 7 FontData, so every time 'a' is typed in the Java Editor, 91 (7*13) FontData will be loaded.", 
 "EB": "No explicit expected behavior is mentioned.", 
 "SR": "Try adding a system.out.println statement in the first line of the method Font.getFontData, run a self-hosted eclipse, and watch the console. I am concerned about this problem because on some platforms, the performance of this method is very poor compared to Windows. For example, Motif running on UTF8."}

origin.input_content:

', 'OB': "Running eclipse, using the Java Editor: A single key stroke can cause the APIFont.getFontData() to be called 13 times. This API is also overused when we are scrolling the StyledText andselecting text. Each Font has 7 FontData, therefore everytime I type 'a' in the JavaEditor 91 (713) FontData will be loaded.
